snippet: The presidential candidate’s proposal would reduce guarantees of coverage for pre-existing conditions and allow states to set work requirements for Medicaid recipients.
abstract: Jeb Bush presents proposal that would replace most of Affordable Care Act with more conservative health care plan; it could reduce individual insurance expenses but would likely not cover as many people as Pres Obama's plan.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and MATT FLEGENHEIMER
byline.contributor: Robert Pear reported from Washington, and Matt Flegenheimer from New York.

lead_paragraph: The presidential candidate’s proposal would reduce guarantees of coverage for pre-existing conditions and allow states to set work requirements for Medicaid recipients.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Offers Health Plan That Would Undo Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Bush Offers Health Plan That Would Replace Much of the Affordable Care Act

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
